articles.title: Billboard Argentina
articles.description: Plus, Mora and Sech's "Tus Lágrimas" scores the highest debut at No. 82.
articles.content:
Paulo Londra’s “Plan A” spends a fifth week at No. 1 on the Billboard Argentina Hot 100 chart (dated April 23). The track ties Londra’s longest-leading title to date, “Adan y Eva,” which also topped the chart for five consecutive weeks.

articles.title: 23.5 Million Tickets Sought in Latest World Cup Sale: FIFA
articles.description: The most popular games are the final on December 18 alongside some of the group games which are already known: Argentina v Mexico, Argentina v Saudi Arabia, England v United States and Poland v Argentina
articles.content: FIFA said Friday that 23.5 million World Cup tickets were requested in the latest round of sales for the tournament that starts in Qatar in less than seven months. Applications from Argentina, Brazil, England, France, Mexico, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, and... [2723 chars]

articles.title: IP protection: India among most challenging economies, says USTR
articles.description: In its 2022 Special 301 Report, the USTR designated seven countries in the Priority Watch List. These are Argentina, Chile, China, India, Indonesia, Russia and Venezuela.
articles.content:
India remains one of the most challenging major economies with respect to protection and enforcement of intellectual property, the office of the US Trade Representative said in a report as it decided to retain New Delhi on the Priority Watch List.

articles.title: ‘Jute for wheat’ - what is historical India-Argentina barter deal Jaishankar talked about
articles.description: While documentation about barter treaty is sparse, it was inked in 1949 when India, a leading commercial producer of jute, was experiencing a food crisis.

articles.title: China, Russia, India Among Seven Countries on US Property Rights Blacklist
articles.description: Also on the Office of the US Trade Representatives priority watch list were Argentina, Chile, Indonesia and Venezuela
articles.content:
The United States has put China, Russia and five other countries on its annual blacklist for lax enforcement of intellectual property rights that leaves American companies vulnerable to copyright and trademark piracy.

articles.title: Argentine grains farmers see mostly flat sales for corn, soy dips
articles.description: BUENOS AIRES, April 26 (Reuters) - Argentina's farmers are on track for relatively flat corn sales in the current cycle while the soybean harvest dips, according to official data released on Tuesday, with both crops providing crucial export revenues for the country's battered economy.Argentina is a major international grains producer and exporter, but the commodity market has
